page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: Farming Most of the farms in the block are{hill farms}producing{sheep}and {cattle}for meat. Some however produce milk . Almost all of the fields grow grass for grazing, hay making and silage. Many farms are quite small. We interviewed a farmer in{Bradwell} who specializes in{sheep}production. The farm was 57 hectares. This was able to produce much of the feed but a little hay and a fair amount of corn had to be purchased from outside. The best land, where the sheep fattened most quickly, was the limestone side (west). Each year the lambs are sold for slaughter at Hartington sheep sale where new ewes for the next year are bought to replace those that were too old to be of further use at the farm.
